page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block(03800372) appears to be about the village{Chelford}but,as page 2 reveals, the village heart has moved. The present village is dissected by the Northern boundary of the block. The Commercial part(the only bank,shops,etc) is in this block but the main housing is in the block to the North.The block is mainly farming with some sand extraction. Most people commute out to work. The land is well wooded with ponds and lakes. Two major roads -the Knutsford to Macclesfield A537 and the Alderley Edge to Holmes Chapel A535 - cross at a roundabout at the site of the original village. The main Manchester to Crewe railway crosses to the N.W. corner where the station can be found. There has been considerable population growth in the last ten years.
